snippet: The ATP Player Council, with Roger Federer as its president, is pushing for more prize money at Grand Slam tournaments in an attempt to address an earning gap in a top-heavy sport.
abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column notes that the ATP Player Council, with Roger Federer as its president, is pushing for more prize money at Grand Slam tournaments in an attempt to address an earning gap in a top-heavy sport.
lead_paragraph: The ATP Player Council, with Roger Federer as its president, is pushing for more prize money at Grand Slam tournaments in an attempt to address an earning gap in a top-heavy sport.

headline.seo: Tennis Stars Pressure Grand Slams Over Prize Money
headline.main: Off Court, Tennis Stars Are Putting Pressure on the Grand Slams
headline.print_headline: Off Court, Stars Are Pressuring Grand Slams
